sentence: The primary is divided among four Democrats: Congressman Conor Lamb, who won an intensely fought race for a swingy district in the western part of the state in 2018; Lieutenant Governor John Fetterman, a six-foot-nine Democrat aligned with the progressive wing of the party; state Representative Malcolm Kenyatta, another progressive who is the only Black candidate in the primary; and Dr. Val Arkoosh, the chair of the Montgomery county commission—a crucial Philadelphia suburb.
author: Daniel Strauss
title: Democrats Can Win the Pennsylvania Senate Seat—if They Don’t Slaughter One Another First

author: Hanna Trudo
title: Is Fetterman pulling away in the Pennsylvania Senate race?

sentence: US Senate candidate John Fetterman has described himself as a democratic socialist If Your Time is short The ad alludes to a 2020 NPR story that called Fetterman a self-described democratic socialist.
author: Tom Kertscher
title: "John Fetterman's a self-described democratic socialist."

sentence: A super PAC supporting Rep. Conor Lamb for U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania made two misleading claims about the Democratic front-runner, John Fetterman, one of which resulted in a Philadelphia TV station pulling the ad.
author: Robert Farley
title: Pro-Lamb Super PAC Misfires in Attack Ad Against Fetterman

sentence: “I believe that the vote was misguided, and that is something that I would never be a part of.” John Fetterman says he was “dismayed” by the Squad’s opposition of Iron Dome funding for Israel — and adds other choice words for the left wing of his party.
author: Michael Ginsberg
title: Pennsylvania Lt. Gov. John Fetterman Calls Out ‘Misguided’ ‘Squad’ For Anti-Israel Vote
Debate expone diferencias entre demócratas en la contienda por el Senado
